title: Practical Considerations for FAIR Data for the APT and FIM Communities: Lessons Learned from the NIST Electron Microscopy Facility
content: By now we have all seen the steady stream of news about ChatGPT or other AI engines and their fantastic capabilities at reasoning. Yet, scientific research data still feels very far from being able to wow us on that scale. But what does it take to make scientific research data AI-ready? Are we missing big opportunities by regarding our raw instrument outputs as valuable only until the paper is published?
